description.@value: It’s really easy to make your own herb-flavoured vinegars. You can use them for pickling veggies or they make a nice and interesting change in a salad dressing too.

recipeInstructions.@value:
If your elderflower heads are freshly picked, give them a good shake to discard any little bugs.
							
								Pick the flowers from the stalks, pack them into a clean jar and cover them in the vinegar. Seal and refrigerate.
							
								After 2 weeks, pour the vinegar through a fine mesh sieve or muslin into a sterilised jar or bottle and store in a dark, dry place. Discard the strained flowers. It will keep for up to 2 months.
